article.title: Generalized boundary triples, Weyl functions and inverse problems

multiple_choice_question.text: The abstract Green\'s identity is a crucial concept in the theory of boundary triples. Which of the following formulas correctly represents this identity?
The Weyl function plays a central role in analyzing the spectral properties of selfadjoint extensions. Which formula defines the abstract Weyl function M(λ)?
choices: M(λ)Γ0fλ = Γ1fλ, γ(λ)Γ0fλ = fλ, fλ ∈ Nλ, λ ∈ ρ(A0)
M(λ)Γ1fλ = Γ0fλ, γ(λ)Γ1fλ = fλ, fλ ∈ Nλ, λ ∈ ρ(A0)
M(λ)γ(λ)fλ = Γ1fλ, Γ0fλ = fλ, fλ ∈ Nλ, λ ∈ ρ(A0)
M(λ)γ(λ)fλ = Γ0fλ, Γ1fλ = fλ, fλ ∈ Nλ, λ ∈ ρ(A0)

multiple_choice_question.text: The concept of form domain invariance is crucial for characterizing ES-generalized boundary triples. Which formula defines the quadratic form tM(λ) associated with the imaginary part of M(λ)?
choices: tM(λ)[u, v] := (λ − λ¯) [(M(λ)u, v) − (u, M(λ)v)], u, v ∈ dom(M(λ)), λ ∈ C \\ R
tM(λ)[u, v] := (λ + λ¯) [(M(λ)u, v) + (u, M(λ)v)], u, v ∈ dom(M(λ)), λ ∈ C \\ R
